item.title: N15 4jb n17 6qn, 13th January
item.description:
On the high road. They have been there for as long as I can remember over a decade. Recently another car swereved towards me trying to avoid these potholes. Its only a matter time befor the causes a serious accident. please assist with this serious road hazard, I would really appreciate it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Road, West Green, Greater London

item.title: Collapsed pavement to entrance of flats 36 to 46 Sharnbrooke Close DA16 1SLconcrete, 13th January
item.description:
Collapsed pavement to entrance of flats 36 to 46 Sharnbrooke Close DA16 1SLconcrete. I first reported this problem last August. A few days later someone came and put up 2 maintenance barriers. Weeks passed and nothing was done to repair the collapsed payment. Then Bexley council on their website stated that the problem had being fixed and showing a green check mark on the site map. I called Bexley Council and complained that nothing had being fixed and the problem was getting worse. A lady from Bexley Council told me that it may be misleading stating that the problem had being fixed. She said that the Council had pass this problem to Highways and they would arrange for it to be fixed. So why state on the website that it had being fixed and showing a green check mark on the site map. Bexley Council is misleading people about carrying out road repairs The 2 maintenance barriers have been knocked down a number of times by kids, cars and wind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sharnbrooke Close, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain when heavy rain falls causing flooding and public unable to walk past, 13th January
item.description:
One drain covering the broadway and Harcourt road, whenever we have heavy rainfall the drain cannot cope with it and flooding causes the pavement to become impassable due to the amount of water that gets splashed over. This has been going on for years and should have sorted a long time ago. its very unsafe for anyone trying to walk past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harcourt Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge graffiti that is encouraging others, 13th January
item.description:
This graffiti is a common name around this area. The name is ABOUT. Since the initial graffiti the next wall has been graffitied. This behaviour is criminal damage and contagious. I would like somebody to do something before they continue with another wall. Thankyou. Asylum rd peckham,opposite the queen's Rd station and opposite the asylum pub on the same rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Asylum Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
